intro: Echinacanthus brugmansianus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Echinacanthus brugmansianus thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
